private_information: I arrive at Richmond District at 09:00.
I can travel between Richmond District and Bayview taking 26 minutes one way and 25 minutes the other way.
I want to meet as many friends as possible and I must meet Sarah for at least 45 minutes.
visitor.goal: Meet as many friends as possible and meet Sarah for at least 45 minutes during her availability.

private_information: I will be at Bayview from 14:15 to 17:30.
I am available to meet at Bayview during that window.
sarah.goal: Meet the visitor at Bayview for a minimum of 45 minutes within my availability window.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent information and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward to find schedules that maximize meetings and satisfy constraints.

public_information: Neighborhoods of interest are Richmond District and Bayview.
Travel times are Richmond District to Bayview 26 minutes and Bayview to Richmond District 25 minutes.
The visitor arrives in Richmond District at 09:00.
Objective is to plan meeting schedules and optimize number and quality of meetings.

inform.system_prompt: You are the visitor providing your known schedule constraints and meeting preferences. Provide clear structured facts about your arrival time location travel tolerances and meeting priorities.
inform.prompt: Your name is visitor. Here is the public environment information. {environment->public_information} Here is your private information. {agents->visitor->private_information} Your goal is {agents->visitor->goal} Provide a concise structured summary of your constraints preferences and flexibility for scheduling meetings. Do not emit PDDL.

inform.system_prompt: You are a friend providing your availability and location for meeting. Provide clear structured facts about your availability window location and any constraints on meeting duration or times.
inform.prompt: Your name is sarah. Here is the public environment information. {environment->public_information} Here is your private information. {agents->sarah->private_information} Your goal is {agents->sarah->goal} Provide a concise structured summary of your availability and any constraints. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL targeting the FastDownward solver. You must integrate agents information to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem compatible with FastDownward. Keep agent actions distinct and model time and travel durations. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive structured facts from the visitor and from sarah. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and the agents summaries {info_visitor} and {info_sarah} to build a temporal or time-expanded PDDL model that represents locations Richmond District and Bayview travel durations 26 and 25 minutes arrival time 09:00 sarah availability 14:15 to 17:30 and the requirement that the visitor meets sarah at Bayview for at least 45 minutes. Consider different candidate schedules and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encode the optimization objective of maximizing number of meetings and ensuring the required meeting with sarah. Target FastDownward as the solver. Enclose domain and problem in the required tags.
